treatment.description: Leaves: petiole villous, hairs tawny to brown; blade somewhat lustrous adaxially, 52–97 mm, abaxial surface densely villous, hairs tawny.
treatment.habitat: Upland and floodplain forests, sandhills, hammocks
treatment.discussion: The type for the species was collected in Georgia; subsp. lanuginosum occurs mostly in the southeastern states.
